head.supplied: 27/1/80. ¶ ¶ It has occurred to me, dear Mr Odgers, that the liberality of the West Australian Government should be reciprocated in sending to the Victorian Government a number of copies of the Fores...

div.p: R80/1953, unit 1131, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

It has occurred to me, dear Mr Odgers, that the liberality of the West Australian Government should be reciprocated in sending to the Victorian Government a number of copies of the Forest-Report,
B79.13.10; see also M to M. Fraser, 17 January 1880. by forwarding a few (perhaps 5) copies of the Eucalyptus-Atlas,
i.e. B79.13.11 and subsequent issues. brought out here as far as ready. Ours will be at least 100 plates, theirs is 20, so five copies seem to represent a fair return-gift.
M's suggestion was followed up. Instructions were sent to the Government Printer on 24 February 1880 and a letter to the Colonial Secretary of WA on 25 February. Y1240.
